descr.samples.demos.cornerButtons.sample:
Easy Input - Corner Buttons


Short sample showing how to use the "Easy Input - Corner Buttons" module.

Instructions:
- Tap the bottom-left button to bounce right.
- Tap the bottom-right button to bounce left.
- On simulator*, tap "A" & "D" or "Left Arrow" & "Right Arrow" for same response. (debug feature)


* If you're running the simulator under Windows, select an android device to enable
keyboard input.

descr.samples.demos.twoTouch.sample:
Easy Input - Two Touch


Short sample showing how to use the "Easy Input - Two Touch" module.

Instructions:
- Tap the left and right sides of the screen to make the smiley "ball" bounce.
- On simulator*, tap "A" & "D" or "Left Arrow" & "Right Arrow" for same response. (debug feature)


* If you're running the simulator under Windows, select an android device to enable
keyboard input.
descr.samples.demos.twoStick.sample:
Easy Input - Two Stick


Short sample showing how to use the "Easy Input - Two Stick" module.

Instructions:
- Touch the left-side of the screen and move finger to activate the left "virtual" joystick.
This will move and rotate the smiley 'ball'
- Touch the right-side of the screen and move finger to activate the right "virtual" joystick.
This will rotate the smiley 'ball'
descr.samples.demos.oneTouch.sample:
Easy Input - One Touch


Short sample showing how to use the "Easy Input - One Touch" module.

Instructions:
- Tap the screen to make the smiley "ball" bounce.
- On simulator*, tap "W" or "Up Arrow" for same response. (debug feature)


* If you're running the simulator under Windows, select an android device to enable
keyboard input.

Corona Twine (JUN 2013)

descr.samples.demos.oneStickOneTouch.sample:
Easy Input - One Stick + One Touch


Short sample showing how to use the "Easy Input - One Stick + One Touch" module.

Instructions:
- Touch the left side of screen and move finger to activate the "virtual" joystick.
This will rotate the smiley 'ball'
- Hold right side of screen to move the smiley 'bal'.

descr.samples.core.001_newCircle.sample:
ssk.display.newCircle()


SSK provides a new implementation of display.newCircle() that allows you to create
complex circle objects using very little code.

With this version of newCircle(), you can do all of the following:

> Modify visual parameters via a parameterized table.
> Add a physics body and manipulate all standard settings via a parameterized table.
> Automatically attach any of the Corona-specified event listeners.
> and more ...

with a single line of code.

Basic Syntax:

ssk.display.newCircle( group, x, y [, visualParams [, bodyParams ] ] )
